content.raw:
Well, I don’t know how to cherry pick in Git, let alone Mercurial. Yes,
it’s not finished. I was planning to implement a facade class that would
replace the current closure form of _make_chain that would provide a map
method to automatically chain together calls to map on the underlying file
sequence, similar to the facade I suggested for iterfind. I was tinkering
with it until I realized I didn’t know enough about how the context manager
part of _make_chain worked, and I don’t actually use it so I was just going
to shelve it until later.

I suppose I can just delete it and that will clean up the file in the
branch and propagate to the PR.
content.html:
Well, I don’t know how to cherry pick in Git, let alone Mercurial. Yes, it’s not finished. I was planning to implement a facade class that would replace the current closure form of _make_chain that would provide a map method to automatically chain together calls to map on the underlying file sequence, similar to the facade I suggested for iterfind. I was tinkering with it until I realized I didn’t know enough about how the context manager part of _make_chain worked, and I don’t actually use it so I was just going to shelve it until later.

I suppose I can just delete it and that will clean up the file in the branch and propagate to the PR.
